column4: we got that working, what program do you use to view the output?
feel free. why wouldnt anyone want that to happen? its getting people to believe you as a trusted source thats the problem
just make sure the people installing know that
I dont even have an hda, all my drives are SATA which means SCSI interface which means sda
but I did think of that, and I did fsck em, they are quite clean
could be udev or hal trying to make them hda type devices. and from that it will obviously think its bad if its an SATA drive. gmm
your guess is as good as mine on that one.  But I kid you not, these errors showed up when I was testing a router's weakness to ARP poisoning
hotplug. try grepping for something about hda and hotplug...
so modules are getting loaded by themselves?
yeh, my guess is something like udev, hal, or hotplug are loading this drive but dont recognise it as SATA...
you might be right, but the network traffic link doesnt make sense, but here it is, I can reproduce it with ettercap...
probably something to do withy the inner workings of module alias's and the automations. File a bug if you can find the root of this evil. However, i gtg :(
thanks for the help on tracking this down, I nearly had a heart attack looking at my logs this morning

i can imagine :D try giving dapper live cd a spin, and see if its fixed. otherwise, get onto it in the bug lists, coz this is really something that could send bells ringing in system admins on server and such!
I can't get this specific setup for testing again till next friday, but I will.  I need a shower and new pants now
